document_data.name: Thaergar
document_data.mainbody: '''Thaergar''', or '''Thaergar of the Doors''' was a guard in the [[Veltalar]] palace in the mid-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Personality: He liked to play with mice.
document_data.Possessions: He had a dagger at his belt and a shiny sword,{{cite book/Elminster in Hell/Hardcover 2001|341|22}} but normally wielded a glaive, wearing a gauntlet on at least one hand. The belt also held a bag of dice, some cheese on a string, and an ''[[air solitaire deck]]'' with the beauties of [[Thay]] on the back of every card.
document_data.History:
As of {{yearlink|1372}}, Thaergar had long served [[the Simbul]]. During the day in which she went scouring [[Avernus]] in search of [[Elminster]], he gave her his belt after she forgot to put on her own, accidentally losing that way a pack of ''air solitaire'' cards, and a cheese and string kit for a mouse he liked to play with.{{cite book/Elminster in Hell/Hardcover 2001|241|16}}

After the tumult upon the return of [[Elminster]], Thaergar managed to prevent Phaeldara from getting crushed by some rubble. It took some time to dig them out.{{cite book/Elminster in Hell/Hardcover 2001|345|22}}
